assoc_actor_2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Uprising by radical Islamic militia causes clashes with police and military; 800 people were killed over four days of fighting in Maiduguri, and hundreds more were arrested. On the fourth day, the leader of the group, Mohammed Yusuf, was captured by security forces at his home in Maiduguri, and later killed in custody. Boko Haram quickly appointed a new leader, changed tactics and became even more violent.

notes: Members of the Boko Haram sect militia attacked and destroyed the Dutsen Tanshi police station in Bauchi in retaliation for the killing of 17 of its members on 11 June by security forces in Maiduguri. This attack is thought to have sparked off a wave of unrest, which swept through Bauchi, Borno, Kano, Katsina and Yobe states until at least 30 July, when Boko Harams leader was captured and later killed by police.
